body: The following section details a sorcerer bloodline and new feats and spells favored by ghouls.
name: New Rules

sections.body: Sorcerers whose ancestors were afflicted by ghoul fever but somehow survived often end up with this bloodline.
sections.name: Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline

sections.body: Your connection to the hungering undead shapes your magic.
sections.name: Ghoul
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul

sections.body: Ray of enfeeblement (3rd), feast of ashes (5th), vampiric touch (7th), fear (9th), hungry earth * (11th), move earth (13th), control undead (15th), unholy aura (17th), wail of the banshee (19th).

sections.body: Whenever you cast a spell of the necromancy school that deals hit point damage, you are healed of 1 hit point per spell level.

sections.name: Bloodline Arcana

sections.body: The dark energies that fuel your existence and undying hunger form the basis of your power.
sections.name: Bloodline Powers
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers

sections.body:
: Starting at 1st level, you can grow claws as a free action. These claws are treated as natural weapons, allowing you to make two claw attacks as a full attack using your full base attack bonus. Each of these attacks deals 1d4 points of damage + your Strength modifier (1d3 if you are Small). At 5th level, creatures damaged with your claw attack are paralyzed for 1 round, as the ghoul ability (Fortitude negates). At 7th level, the duration of the paralysis increases to 1d4+1 rounds, and the claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming DR. You can use your claws for a number of rounds per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. These rounds do not need to be consecutive.

If you're a ghoul with this bloodline, instead of gaining this ability, your levels in sorcerer stack with your racial Hit Dice when determining the DC of your paralysis and disease special abilities.
sections.name: Ghoulish Claws
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers/Ghoulish Claws

sections.body: : At 3rd level, you gain cold resistance 5 and a +1 natural armor bonus to AC. At 9th level, your cold resistance increases to 10 and natural armor bonus increases to +2. At 15th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
sections.name: Leathery Skin
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers/Leathery Skin

sections.body: : At 9th level, you gain the benefits of haste for a number of rounds per day equal to your sorcerer level. These rounds don't need to be consecutive. Each time you hit a creature with two or more claw attacks during a full attack while affected by this ability, that creature takes 1d4 points of bleed damage.
sections.name: Ravenous Frenzy
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers/Ravenous Frenzy

sections.body: : At 15th level, you gain a burrow speed of 30 feet. Additionally, as long as you are surrounded by at least 5 feet of dirt or natural stone on all sides, you gain fast healing 10. You can heal a number of hit points per day equal to 10 × your sorcerer level with this ability.
sections.name: Earth Crawler
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers/Earth Crawler

sections.body: : At 20th level, you take on aspects of the nature and appearance of ghouls. You no longer feel the need to eat and are immune to hunger (though you are still able to consume flesh if you choose to). You gain immunity to cold, nonlethal damage, paralysis, and sleep. You also gain DR 5/—. Additionally, you gain the stench ability with a radius of 10 feet. Creatures that fail their Fortitude saving throws are sickened for 1d6+4 minutes. Use half your sorcerer level instead of half your racial Hit Dice to determine the saving throw DC.
sections.name: Ghoulish Aspect
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Sorcerer Bloodline/Ghoul/Bloodline Powers/Ghoulish Aspect

sections.body: The following feats open up additional ability options for ghouls.
sections.name: Ghoul Feats
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats

sections.body: Your undead form ignores the limits of mortal physiology.
sections.name: Bag of Bones
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats/Bag of Bones

sections.body: Ghoul.
sections.name: Prerequisite

sections.body: You are treated as one size smaller for the purpose of calculating penalties for squeezing, and gain a +5 competence bonus on Escape Artist checks. If you possess 10 or more Hit Dice, this bonus increases to +4.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You have an undead animal companion.
sections.name: Corpse Companion
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats/Corpse Companion

sections.body: Animal companion class feature, ghoul.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: Your animal companion's type changes to undead, but its Hit Dice, base attack bonus, saving throws, skills, and tricks are retained from the base creature. The creature loses its Constitution score and its Charisma score becomes 12. If your companion is destroyed, your new companion is undead as well, using these same modifications.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You have been dead for so long you have become quite difficult to kill.
sections.name: Old as Dust
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats/Old as Dust

sections.body: Sleeper, Warren Digger, creature has been a ghoul for at least 500 years.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you are not destroyed­—you cannot be killed unless your body is completely destroyed with fire or doused in holy water, or you take damage from a cure spell or channeled positive energy after you've been reduced to 0 hit points. Anytime you are reduced to 0 hit points, you remain unconscious until you are healed or until the following midnight, at which time you regain 1 hit point per Hit Die and awaken.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: By seeking solace in the grave, you are able to recuperate more quickly.
sections.name: Sleeper
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats/Sleeper

sections.body: Warren Digger, ghoul.
sections.name: Prerequisites

sections.body: You heal 1 hit point per 10 minutes as long as you are surrounded by at least 5 feet of dirt or stone on all sides and take no actions.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: After years spent digging up graves, you are able to move through dirt almost as easily as a fish through water.
sections.name: Warren Digger
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Feats/Warren Digger

sections.body: Ghoul.
sections.name: Prerequisite

sections.body: You gain a burrow speed of 10 feet through earth, sand, or soil.
sections.name: Benefit

sections.body: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take it, add 10 feet to your burrow speed, up to a maximum of your base land speed.
sections.name: Special

sections.body: Ghoul spells reflect their obsession with hunger and death.
sections.name: Ghoul Spells
sections.url: pfsrd://Monster Codex/Rules/Ghouls/New Rules/Ghoul Spells

sections.body: The target's flesh fills out and gains a healthy, natural color. This gives the target the appearance of a living creature of the type it was when it was still alive (if applicable). Creatures casting spells such as detect undead must succeed at a saving throw (with a DC equal to the spell's save DC) to detect the target's presence, and if the target is intelligent, it gains a +10 bonus on Disguise checks to appear alive or recently deceased. If the undead has any features different from those of the type of living creature it most resembles (such as a ghoul's elongated teeth and claws), those features shrink and become less prominent, and the subject deals damage as though it were one size smaller. This spell has no effect on creatures that are skeletal or otherwise lack flesh.

sections.body:
The ground attempts to pull creatures beneath its surface as if hungry for the flesh of mortals.

Immediately, and at the beginning of each of your turns, every creature touching the ground within the area of the spell is the target of a grapple combat maneuver. Creatures that enter the area of effect are also automatically attacked. The ground does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The earth's CMB is equal to 5 + your caster level for the purpose of this combat maneuver check. Attempt the combat maneuver check only once each round and apply the result to all creatures in the area of effect.

Each time the ground succeeds at a combat maneuver check to grapple a foe, it drags the creature farther down, eventually forcing the creature below its surface. With the first successful check, the target gains the grappled condition. Grappled opponents can't move without first breaking the grapple (doing so requires a successful DC 20 combat maneuver or Escape Artist check). The ground receives a +5 bonus on combat maneuver checks to grapple opponents it is already grappling. After the second successful grapple combat maneuver check, the grappled creature is pulled to the ground and becomes prone. On the third successful grapple combat maneuver check, the creature is fully buried and must hold its breath or begin suffocating.

A buried creature can't attempt to escape unless the effect ends or it breaks the grapple. The DC to escape the grapple increases to 25 for a creature that has been pulled beneath the earth.
